events.name: DevOpsDays Singapore
events.description: https://ti.to/devopsdays-singapore/2015/ Join us for 2-days DevOpsDays and connect with DevOps professionals from all over the world and share your experiences, ideas, and tools relating to DevOps and Agile. Checkout the program: http://www.devopsdays.org/events/2015-singapore/program/ About DevOpsDays DevOpsDays is a 2-days conference that brings development and operations together. We have exciting keynote sessions, talks and open spaces to combine all the benefits of a traditional conference with the benefits of unconference. Why Attend? Whether you're in government, academia, or the private sector, DevOpsDays is for you. Whether you're in operations, development, QA, security, or any other department, DevOpsDays is for you. Whether you want to learn about DevOps, share your experiences, or just talk shop with DevOps practitioners, DevOpsDays is for you. DevOpsDays are a mix of keynote sessions and open spaces. The keynotes and open spaces will include discussions on topics such as: Register As a member of the DevOps Meetup Group you can use the discount code 'DEVOPS_MEETUP' (without quotes) while getting your ticket to enjoy a discount on your tickets! Register here: https://ti.to/devopsdays-singapore/2015/ See you soon! (RSVP is not required and it does not count as registration)
events.location: Raffles City Convention Centre, 80 Bras Basah Rd Singapore 189560

events.name: Friday Hacks #100: Engaging with the tech community beyond school, Lightning talks, and free beer!
events.description:
NUS Hackers is celebrating our 100th Friday Hacks!

To mark this occasion, we have a very special talk from Sayanee about engaging with the tech community beyond school. We'll also be holding Lightning talks (5mins each) with speakers from NUS, NTU, SUTD and all over Singapore!

If you're interested to give a lightning talk, contact vishnu@nushackers.org.

We'll update this event description with confirmed lightning talks on Friday.

After-Event Bash

There's going to be a after-event bash with free food and beer.

Description: 

How can a student engage with the technology industry beyond school? This talk will scan through practical tips for getting started online and getting involved with projects. What communities can you join easily and learn? Which meetups can you attend and even help to co-organize? How to start contributing to open source? Can we easily share with by writing our own blogs, books or even making podcasts? What are some interesting social media accounts or blogs to follow? How can we add in short trips to engage with locals while traveling anywhere in the world? We will discuss all these questions and more!

Speaker profile:

Sayanee Basu is a full stack developer working with emerging web technologies at Ricoh Pte. Ltd. in Singapore. Her key interest lies in connecting the web and the internet to the physical world through sensors and hence, much of her free time is now spent in tinkering with electronics and computer networks. She creates Build Podcast, a screencast series on developer tools as well as actively contributes to the Singapore tech community through curation of events, open source projects at webuild.sg and a developer focused podcast with We Build LIVE. She graduated from National University of Singapore in Electrical Engineering.

You can find out more about her at http://sayan.ee!
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, National University of Singapore

events.name: TGIFHacks #40 - Interactive Web-app w Angular JS
events.description:
In this workshop, we will learn how to build an interactive web-apps using state-of-the-art JavaScript framework Angular JS. Besides writing the code, you could also expect to know more about popular front end architectures and design patterns.

Requirements
•	Basic knowledge of HTML. (If you have participated in our prev workshop on HTML this is for you! if not, just visit http://tinyurl.com/tgifhacks37 and read the introduction!

Preparation
•	Understand the role of JavaScript and backend programs in PHP or Python or etc. Link: http://blog.teamtreehouse.com/i-dont-speak-your-language-frontend-vs-backend
•	Learn basic JavaScript syntaxes. Link: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide
•	Charge your laptop and bring it to the workshop!
